body:
$! You don't need to tell DVLA if you've had a hysterectomy. $!

If you've had a hysterectomy, you shouldn't drive until your doctor tells you that you are safe to do so. This can be between 3 to 8 weeks after the operation.

*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
overview: You don't need to tell DVLA if you've had a hysterectomy
title: Hysterectomy and driving
